Enum.description: MCU security status is unsecure
MCU security status is secure
Freescale factory access denied
Freescale factory access granted
Mass erase is disabled
Mass erase is enabled
Backdoor key access enabled
Backdoor key access disabled
Low-power boot
Normal boot
Force Boot from ROM if BOOTCFG0 asserted, where BOOTCFG0 is the boot config function which is muxed with NMI pin
Boot source configured by FOPT (BOOTSRC_SEL) bits
NMI interrupts are always blocked
NMI_b pin/interrupts reset default to enabled
Slower initialization
Fast Initialization
Boot from Flash
Boot from ROM, configure QSPI0, and enter boot loader mode.
Boot from ROM and enter boot loader mode.

Park on master port M0
Park on master port M1
Park on master port M2
Park on master port M3
Park on master port M4
Park on master port M5
Park on master port M6
Park on master port M7
When no master makes a request, the arbiter parks the slave port on the master port defined by the PARK field
When no master makes a request, the arbiter parks the slave port on the last master to be in control of the slave port
When no master makes a request, the slave port is not parked on a master and the arbiter drives all outputs to a constant safe state
Fixed priority
Round-robin, or rotating, priority
The low power mode request has the highest priority for arbitration on this slave port
The low power mode request has the lowest initial priority for arbitration on this slave port
The slave port's registers are writeable
The slave port's registers are read-only and cannot be written. Attempted writes have no effect on the registers and result in a bus error response.

When in debug mode, the DMA continues to operate.
When in debug mode, the DMA stalls the start of a new channel. Executing channels are allowed to complete. Channel execution resumes when the system exits debug mode or the EDBG bit is cleared.
Fixed priority arbitration is used for channel selection within each group.
Round robin arbitration is used for channel selection within each group.
Fixed priority arbitration is used for selection among the groups.
Round robin arbitration is used for selection among the groups.
Normal operation
Any error causes the HALT bit to set. Subsequently, all service requests are ignored until the HALT bit is cleared.
Normal operation
Stall the start of any new channels. Executing channels are allowed to complete. Channel execution resumes when this bit is cleared.
A minor loop channel link made to itself goes through channel arbitration before being activated again.

A minor loop channel link made to itself does not go through channel arbitration before being activated again. Upon minor loop completion, the channel activates again if that channel has a minor loop channel link enabled and the link channel is itself. This effectively applies the minor loop offsets and restarts the next minor loop.
Disabled. TCDn.word2 is defined as a 32-bit NBYTES field.

Enabled. TCDn.word2 is redefined to include individual enable fields, an offset field, and the NBYTES field. The individual enable fields allow the minor loop offset to be applied to the source address, the destination address, or both. The NBYTES field is reduced when either offset is enabled.
Normal operation

Cancel the remaining data transfer in the same fashion as the CX bit. Stop the executing channel and force the minor loop to finish. The cancel takes effect after the last write of the current read/write sequence. The ECX bit clears itself after the cancel is honored. In addition to cancelling the transfer, ECX treats the cancel as an error condition, thus updating the Error Status register (DMAx_ES) and generating an optional error interrupt.
Normal operation

Cancel the remaining data transfer. Stop the executing channel and force the minor loop to finish. The cancel takes effect after the last write of the current read/write sequence. The CX bit clears itself after the cancel has been honored. This cancel retires the channel normally as if the minor loop was completed.
No destination bus error
The last recorded error was a bus error on a destination write
No source bus error
The last recorded error was a bus error on a source read
No scatter/gather configuration error

The last recorded error was a configuration error detected in the TCDn_DLASTSGA field. This field is checked at the beginning of a scatter/gather operation after major loop completion if TCDn_CSR[ESG] is enabled. TCDn_DLASTSGA is not on a 32 byte boundary.
No NBYTES/CITER configuration error

The last recorded error was a configuration error detected in the TCDn_NBYTES or TCDn_CITER fields. TCDn_NBYTES is not a multiple of TCDn_ATTR[SSIZE] and TCDn_ATTR[DSIZE], or TCDn_CITER[CITER] is equal to zero, or TCDn_CITER[ELINK] is not equal to TCDn_BITER[ELINK]
No destination offset configuration error
The last recorded error was a configuration error detected in the TCDn_DOFF field. TCDn_DOFF is inconsistent with TCDn_ATTR[DSIZE].
No destination address configuration error
The last recorded error was a configuration error detected in the TCDn_DADDR field. TCDn_DADDR is inconsistent with TCDn_ATTR[DSIZE].
No source offset configuration error
The last recorded error was a configuration error detected in the TCDn_SOFF field. TCDn_SOFF is inconsistent with TCDn_ATTR[SSIZE].
No source address configuration error.
The last recorded error was a configuration error detected in the TCDn_SADDR field. TCDn_SADDR is inconsistent with TCDn_ATTR[SSIZE].

BitField.name: ERRCHN
BitField.description: Error Channel Number or Canceled Channel Number

Enum.description: No channel priority error
The last recorded error was a configuration error in the channel priorities within a group. Channel priorities within a group are not unique.
No group priority error
The last recorded error was a configuration error among the group priorities. All group priorities are not unique.
No canceled transfers
The last recorded entry was a canceled transfer by the error cancel transfer input

Enum.description: The channel is not explicitly started.
The channel is explicitly started via a software initiated service request.

BitField.name: INTMAJOR
BitField.description: Enable an interrupt when major iteration count completes.

Enum.description: The end-of-major loop interrupt is disabled.
The end-of-major loop interrupt is enabled.

BitField.name: INTHALF
BitField.description: Enable an interrupt when major counter is half complete.

Enum.description: The half-point interrupt is disabled.
The half-point interrupt is enabled.
The channel's ERQ bit is not affected.
The channel's ERQ bit is cleared when the major loop is complete.
The current channel's TCD is normal format.
The current channel's TCD specifies a scatter gather format. The DLASTSGA field provides a memory pointer to the next TCD to be loaded into this channel after the major loop completes its execution.

BitField.name: MAJORELINK
BitField.description: Enable channel-to-channel linking on major loop complete

Enum.description: The channel-to-channel linking is disabled.
The channel-to-channel linking is enabled.
No eDMA engine stalls.
eDMA engine stalls for 4 cycles after each R/W.
eDMA engine stalls for 8 cycles after each R/W.
The channel is not explicitly started.
The channel is explicitly started via a software initiated service request.

Enum.description: The channel-to-channel linking is disabled.
The channel-to-channel linking is enabled.
No eDMA engine stalls.
eDMA engine stalls for 4 cycles after each R/W.
eDMA engine stalls for 8 cycles after each R/W.
The channel is not explicitly started.
The channel is explicitly started via a software initiated service request.

BitField.name: INTMAJOR
BitField.description: Enable an interrupt when major iteration count completes.

Enum.description: The end-of-major loop interrupt is disabled.
The end-of-major loop interrupt is enabled.

BitField.name: INTHALF
BitField.description: Enable an interrupt when major counter is half complete.

Enum.description: The half-point interrupt is disabled.
The half-point interrupt is enabled.
The channel's ERQ bit is not affected.
The channel's ERQ bit is cleared when the major loop is complete.
The current channel's TCD is normal format.
The current channel's TCD specifies a scatter gather format. The DLASTSGA field provides a memory pointer to the next TCD to be loaded into this channel after the major loop completes its execution.

Chip-select is invalid.
Chip-select is valid.
Write accesses are allowed.

Disabled. Data exceeding the specified port size is broken into individual, port-sized, non-burst writes. For example, a 32-bit write to an 8-bit port takes four byte writes.
Enabled. Enables burst write of data larger than the specified port size, including 32-bit writes to 8- and 16-bit ports, 16-bit writes to 8-bit ports, and line writes to 8-, 16-, and 32-bit ports.
Disabled. Data exceeding the specified port size is broken into individual, port-sized, non-burst reads. For example, a 32-bit read from an 8-bit port is broken into four 8-bit reads.
Enabled. Enables data burst reads larger than the specified port size, including 32-bit reads from 8- and 16-bit ports, 16-bit reads from 8-bit ports, and line reads from 8-, 16-, and 32-bit ports.
FB_BE is asserted for data write only.
FB_BE is asserted for data read and write accesses.
32-bit port size. Valid data is sampled and driven on FB_D[31:0].
8-bit port size. Valid data is sampled and driven on FB_D[31:24] when BLS is 0b, or FB_D[7:0] when BLS is 1b.
Disabled. No internal transfer acknowledge is asserted and the cycle is terminated externally.
Enabled. Internal transfer acknowledge is asserted as specified by WS.
Not shifted. Data is left-aligned on FB_AD.
Shifted. Data is right-aligned on FB_AD.
1 cycle (default for all but FB_CS0 )
2 cycles
3 cycles
4 cycles (default for FB_CS0 )
When AA is 1b, 1 cycle. When AA is 0b, 0 cycles.
When AA is 1b, 2 cycles. When AA is 0b, 1 cycle.
When AA is 1b, 3 cycles. When AA is 0b, 2 cycles.
When AA is 1b, 4 cycles. When AA is 0b, 3 cycles.
Assert FB_CSn on the first rising clock edge after the address is asserted (default for all but FB_CS0 ).
Assert FB_CSn on the second rising clock edge after the address is asserted.
Assert FB_CSn on the third rising clock edge after the address is asserted.
Assert FB_CSn on the fourth rising clock edge after the address is asserted (default for FB_CS0 ).

BitField.name: EXTS
BitField.description: Extended Transfer Start/Extended Address Latch Enable Controls how long FB_TS /FB_ALE is asserted.

Enum.description: Disabled. FB_TS /FB_ALE asserts for one bus clock cycle.
Enabled. FB_TS /FB_ALE remains asserted until the first positive clock edge after FB_CSn asserts.
Disabled. A number of wait states (specified by WS) are inserted before an internal transfer acknowledge is generated for all transfers.
Enabled. A number of wait states (specified by SWS) are inserted before an internal transfer acknowledge is generated for burst transfer secondary terminations.
Disabled. Data exceeding the specified port size is broken into individual, port-sized, non-burst writes. For example, a 32-bit write to an 8-bit port takes four byte writes.
Enabled. Enables burst write of data larger than the specified port size, including 32-bit writes to 8- and 16-bit ports, 16-bit writes to 8-bit ports, and line writes to 8-, 16-, and 32-bit ports.
Disabled. Data exceeding the specified port size is broken into individual, port-sized, non-burst reads. For example, a 32-bit read from an 8-bit port is broken into four 8-bit reads.
Enabled. Enables data burst reads larger than the specified port size, including 32-bit reads from 8- and 16-bit ports, 16-bit reads from 8-bit ports, and line reads from 8-, 16-, and 32-bit ports.
FB_BE is asserted for data write only.
FB_BE is asserted for data read and write accesses.
32-bit port size. Valid data is sampled and driven on FB_D[31:0].
8-bit port size. Valid data is sampled and driven on FB_D[31:24] when BLS is 0b, or FB_D[7:0] when BLS is 1b.
Disabled. No internal transfer acknowledge is asserted and the cycle is terminated externally.
Enabled. Internal transfer acknowledge is asserted as specified by WS.
Not shifted. Data is left-aligned on FB_AD.
Shifted. Data is right-aligned on FB_AD.
1 cycle (default for all but FB_CS0 )
2 cycles
3 cycles
4 cycles (default for FB_CS0 )
When AA is 1b, 1 cycle. When AA is 0b, 0 cycles.
When AA is 1b, 2 cycles. When AA is 0b, 1 cycle.
When AA is 1b, 3 cycles. When AA is 0b, 2 cycles.
When AA is 1b, 4 cycles. When AA is 0b, 3 cycles.
Assert FB_CSn on the first rising clock edge after the address is asserted (default for all but FB_CS0 ).
Assert FB_CSn on the second rising clock edge after the address is asserted.
Assert FB_CSn on the third rising clock edge after the address is asserted.
Assert FB_CSn on the fourth rising clock edge after the address is asserted (default for FB_CS0 ).

When AA is 1b, 1 cycle. When AA is 0b, 0 cycles.
When AA is 1b, 2 cycles. When AA is 0b, 1 cycle.
When AA is 1b, 3 cycles. When AA is 0b, 2 cycles.
When AA is 1b, 4 cycles. When AA is 0b, 3 cycles.
Assert FB_CSn on the first rising clock edge after the address is asserted (default for all but FB_CS0 ).
Assert FB_CSn on the second rising clock edge after the address is asserted.
Assert FB_CSn on the third rising clock edge after the address is asserted.
Assert FB_CSn on the fourth rising clock edge after the address is asserted (default for FB_CS0 ).

BitField.name: EXTS
BitField.description: Extended Transfer Start/Extended Address Latch Enable Controls how long FB_TS /FB_ALE is asserted.

Enum.description: Disabled. FB_TS /FB_ALE asserts for one bus clock cycle.
Enabled. FB_TS /FB_ALE remains asserted until the first positive clock edge after FB_CSn asserts.
Disabled. A number of wait states (specified by WS) are inserted before an internal transfer acknowledge is generated for all transfers.
Enabled. A number of wait states (specified by SWS) are inserted before an internal transfer acknowledge is generated for burst transfer secondary terminations.

Register.name: FB_CSPMCR
Register.description: Chip Select port Multiplexing Control Register

Enum.description: FB_CS3 . You must also write 1b to CSCR[AA].
FB_BE_7_0 . You must also write 1b to CSCR[AA].
MPU is disabled. All accesses from all bus masters are allowed.
MPU is enabled
8 region descriptors
12 region descriptors
16 region descriptors
No error has occurred for slave port n.
An error has occurred for slave port n.

3 clocks
6 clocks
9 clocks
9 clocks
Take no action or issue a selfx command to exit self refresh.

SDRAM controller sends a self command to both SDRAM blocks to put them in low-power, self-refresh state where they remain until IS is cleared. When IS is cleared, the controller sends a selfx command for the SDRAMs to exit self-refresh. The refresh counter is suspended while the SDRAMs are in self-refresh; the SDRAM controls the refresh period.
Take no action.

A pall command is sent to the associated SDRAM block. During initialization, this command is executed after all DRAM controller registers are programmed. After IP is set, the next write to an appropriate SDRAM address generates the pall command to the SDRAM block.
32-bit port
8-bit port
16-bit port
16-bit port
Take no action
Initiate mrs command
Do not refresh associated DRAM block
Refresh associated DRAM block
Take no action.

A pall command is sent to the associated SDRAM block. During initialization, this command is executed after all DRAM controller registers are programmed. After IP is set, the next write to an appropriate SDRAM address generates the pall command to the SDRAM block.
32-bit port
8-bit port
16-bit port
16-bit port
Take no action
Initiate mrs command
Do not refresh associated DRAM block
Refresh associated DRAM block
Do not decode DRAM accesses.
Registers controlling the DRAM block are initialized; DRAM accesses can be decoded
Allow write accesses

Ignore write accesses. The DRAM controller ignores write accesses to the memory block and an address exception occurs. Write accesses to a write-protected DRAM region are compared in the chip select module for a hit. If no hit occurs, an external bus cycle is generated. If this external bus cycle is not acknowledged, an access exception occurs.
The associated address bit is used in decoding the DRAM hit to a memory block
The associated address bit is not used in the DRAM hit decode
Do not decode DRAM accesses.
Registers controlling the DRAM block are initialized; DRAM accesses can be decoded

If this external bus cycle is not acknowledged, an access exception occurs.
The associated address bit is used in decoding the DRAM hit to a memory block
The associated address bit is not used in the DRAM hit decode

BitField.name: MGSTAT0
BitField.description: Memory Controller Command Completion Status Flag

Enum.description: No protection violation detected
Protection violation detected
No access error detected
Access error detected
No collision error detected
Collision error detected
Flash command in progress
Flash command has completed
No suspend requested
Suspend the current Erase Flash Sector command execution.
No request or request complete

Request to: run the Erase All Blocks command, verify the erased state, program the security byte in the Flash Configuration Field to the unsecure state, and release MCU security by setting the FSEC[SEC] field to the unsecure state.
Read collision error interrupt disabled
Read collision error interrupt enabled. An interrupt request is generated whenever a flash memory read collision error is detected (see the description of FSTAT[RDCOLERR]).
Command complete interrupt disabled
Command complete interrupt enabled. An interrupt request is generated whenever the FSTAT[CCIF] flag is set.
MCU security status is secure.
MCU security status is secure.
MCU security status is unsecure. (The standard shipping condition of the flash memory module is unsecure.)
MCU security status is secure.
Freescale factory access granted
Freescale factory access denied
Freescale factory access denied
Freescale factory access granted
Mass erase is enabled
Mass erase is enabled
Mass erase is disabled
Mass erase is enabled
Backdoor key access disabled
Backdoor key access disabled (preferred KEYEN state to disable backdoor key access)
Backdoor key access enabled
Backdoor key access disabled

BitField.name: TOFDIR

Resets all RTC registers except for the SWR bit and the RTC_WAR and RTC_RAR registers . The SWR bit is cleared by VBAT POR and by software explicitly clearing it.
Wakeup pin is disabled.
Wakeup pin is enabled and wakeup pin asserts if the RTC interrupt asserts or the wakeup pin is turned on.
Non-supervisor mode write accesses are not supported and generate a bus error.
Non-supervisor mode write accesses are supported.
Registers cannot be written when locked.
Registers can be written when locked under limited conditions.
Wakeup pin asserts (active low, open drain) if the RTC interrupt asserts or the wakeup pin is turned on.
Wakeup pin instead outputs the RTC 32kHz clock, provided the wakeup pin is turned on and the 32kHz clock is output to other peripherals.
32.768 kHz oscillator is disabled.
32.768 kHz oscillator is enabled. After setting this bit, wait the oscillator startup time before enabling the time counter to allow the 32.768 kHz clock time to stabilize.
The 32 kHz clock is output to other peripherals.
The 32 kHz clock is not output to other peripherals.

If the pin is configured for a level sensitive interrupt and the pin remains asserted, then the flag is set again immediately after it is cleared.

Register.name: WDOG_STCTRLH
Register.description: Watchdog Status and Control Register High

BitField.name: WDOGEN
BitField.description: Enables or disables the WDOG's operation

Enum.description: WDOG is disabled.
WDOG is enabled.

BitField.name: CLKSRC
BitField.description: Selects clock source for the WDOG timer and other internal timing operations.

Enum.description: WDOG clock sourced from LPO .
WDOG clock sourced from alternate clock source.

BitField.name: IRQRSTEN
BitField.description: Used to enable the debug breadcrumbs feature

Enum.description: WDOG time-out generates reset only.
WDOG time-out initially generates an interrupt. After WCT, it generates a reset.
Windowing mode is disabled.
Windowing mode is enabled.

BitField.name: ALLOWUPDATE
BitField.description: Enables updates to watchdog write-once registers, after the reset-triggered initial configuration window (WCT) closes, through unlock sequence

Enum.description: No further updates allowed to WDOG write-once registers.
WDOG write-once registers can be unlocked for updating.

BitField.name: DBGEN
BitField.description: Enables or disables WDOG in Debug mode.

Enum.description: WDOG is disabled in CPU Debug mode.
WDOG is enabled in CPU Debug mode.

BitField.name: STOPEN
BitField.description: Enables or disables WDOG in Stop mode.

Enum.description: WDOG is disabled in CPU Stop mode.
WDOG is enabled in CPU Stop mode.

BitField.name: WAITEN
BitField.description: Enables or disables WDOG in Wait mode.

Enum.description: WDOG is disabled in CPU Wait mode.
WDOG is enabled in CPU Wait mode.

BitField.name: TESTWDOG
BitField.description: Puts the watchdog in the functional test mode

BitField.name: TESTSEL
BitField.description: Effective only if TESTWDOG is set. Selects the test to be run on the watchdog timer.

Enum.description: Quick test. The timer runs in normal operation. You can load a small time-out value to do a quick test.

Byte test. Puts the timer in the byte test mode where individual bytes of the timer are enabled for operation and are compared for time-out against the corresponding byte of the programmed time-out value. Select the byte through BYTESEL[1:0] for testing.

BitField.name: BYTESEL
BitField.description: This 2-bit field selects the byte to be tested when the watchdog is in the byte test mode.

Enum.description: Byte 0 selected
Byte 1 selected
Byte 2 selected
Byte 3 selected

BitField.name: DISTESTWDOG
BitField.description: Allows the WDOG's functional test mode to be disabled permanently

Enum.description: WDOG functional test mode is not disabled.
WDOG functional test mode is disabled permanently until reset.

Register.name: WDOG_STCTRLL
Register.description: Watchdog Status and Control Register Low

BitField.name: TOVALHIGH
BitField.description: Defines the upper 16 bits of the 32-bit time-out value for the watchdog timer

BitField.name: TOVALLOW
BitField.description: Defines the lower 16 bits of the 32-bit time-out value for the watchdog timer

BitField.name: WINHIGH
BitField.description: Defines the upper 16 bits of the 32-bit window for the windowed mode of operation of the watchdog

BitField.name: WINLOW
BitField.description: Defines the lower 16 bits of the 32-bit window for the windowed mode of operation of the watchdog

BitField.name: WDOGUNLOCK
BitField.description: Writing the unlock sequence values to this register to makes the watchdog write-once registers writable again

BitField.name: TIMEROUTHIGH
BitField.description: Shows the value of the upper 16 bits of the watchdog timer.

BitField.name: TIMEROUTLOW
BitField.description: Shows the value of the lower 16 bits of the watchdog timer.

BitField.name: RSTCNT
BitField.description: Counts the number of times the watchdog resets the system

BitField.name: PRESCVAL
BitField.description: 3-bit prescaler for the watchdog clock source

BitField.name: SERVICE
BitField.description: The EWM service mechanism requires the CPU to write two values to the SERV register: a first data byte of 0xB4, followed by a second data byte of 0x2C

BitField.name: COMPAREL
BitField.description: To prevent runaway code from changing this field, software should write to this field after a CPU reset even if the (default) minimum service time is required

BitField.name: COMPAREH
BitField.description: To prevent runaway code from changing this field, software should write to this field after a CPU reset even if the (default) maximum service time is required

BitField.name: CLKSEL
BitField.description: EWM has 4 possible low power clock sources for running EWM counter

BitField.name: CLK_DIV
BitField.description: Selected low power clock source for running the EWM counter can be prescaled as below

mul = 1
mul = 2
mul = 4
All DMA signalling disabled.

DMA transfer is enabled. While SMB[FACK] = 0, the following conditions trigger the DMA request: a data byte is received, and either address or data is transmitted. (ACK/NACK is automatic) the first byte received matches the A1 register or is a general call address. If any address matching occurs, S[IAAS] and S[TCF] are set. If the direction of transfer is known from master to slave, then it is not required to check S[SRW]. With this assumption, DMA can also be used in this case. In other cases, if the master reads data from the slave, then it is required to rewrite the C1 register operation. With this assumption, DMA cannot be used. When FACK = 1, an address or a data byte is transmitted.
Normal operation. No interrupt generated when address matching in low power mode.
Enables the wakeup function in low power mode.
An acknowledge signal is sent to the bus on the following receiving byte (if FACK is cleared) or the current receiving byte (if FACK is set).
No acknowledge signal is sent to the bus on the following receiving data byte (if FACK is cleared) or the current receiving data byte (if FACK is set).
Slave mode
Master mode
Acknowledge signal was received after the completion of one byte of data transmission on the bus
No acknowledge signal detected
No interrupt pending
Interrupt pending
Slave receive, master writing to slave
Slave transmit, master reading from slave
Not addressed
Addressed as a slave
Standard bus operation.
Loss of arbitration.
Bus is idle
Bus is busy
Not addressed
Addressed as a slave
Transfer in progress
Transfer complete
Range mode disabled. No address matching occurs for an address within the range of values of the A1 and RA registers.
Range mode enabled. Address matching occurs when a slave receives an address within the range of values of the A1 and RA registers.
The slave baud rate follows the master baud rate and clock stretching may occur
Slave baud rate is independent of the master baud rate
Normal drive mode
High drive mode
7-bit address scheme
10-bit address scheme

Enum.description: No filter/bypass
No start happens on I2C bus
Start detected on I2C bus

BitField.name: SSIE
BitField.description: I2C Bus Stop or Start Interrupt Enable

Enum.description: Stop or start detection interrupt is disabled
Stop or start detection interrupt is enabled
No stop happens on I2C bus
Stop detected on I2C bus
Stop holdoff is disabled. The MCU's entry to stop mode is not gated.
Stop holdoff is enabled.

Register.name: I2C3_SMB
Register.description: I2C SMBus Control and Status register

Enum.description: SHTF2 interrupt is disabled
SHTF2 interrupt is enabled
No SCL high and SDA low timeout occurs
SCL high and SDA low timeout occurs
No SCL high and SDA high timeout occurs
SCL high and SDA high timeout occurs
No low timeout occurs
Low timeout occurs
Timeout counter counts at the frequency of the I2C module clock / 64
Timeout counter counts at the frequency of the I2C module clock
I2C address register 2 matching is disabled
I2C address register 2 matching is enabled
SMBus alert response address matching is disabled
SMBus alert response address matching is enabled
An ACK or NACK is sent on the following receiving data byte
Writing 0 to TXAK after receiving a data byte generates an ACK. Writing 1 to TXAK after receiving a data byte generates a NACK.

Register.name: I2C3_SLTH
Register.description: I2C SCL Low Timeout Register High

Register.name: I2C3_SLTL
Register.description: I2C SCL Low Timeout Register Low

Enum.description: Tx or Rx buffer is not empty and cannot be written to, that is new data cannot be loaded into the buffer.
Tx or Rx buffer is empty and can be written to, that is new data can be loaded into the buffer.
The buffer is not full and all write/read operations have no errors.
There are 3 or more write/read errors during the data transfer phase (when the Empty flag is not set and the buffer is busy).

RegisterGroup.name: USB0
RegisterGroup.description: Universal Serial Bus, OTG Capable Controller

BitField.name: IEHOST
BitField.description: This bit is set if host mode is enabled.

BitField.name: AVBUSCHG
BitField.description: This bit is set when a change in VBUS is detected on an A device.

BitField.name: B_SESS_CHG
BitField.description: This bit is set when a change in VBUS is detected on a B device.

BitField.name: SESSVLDCHG
BitField.description: This bit is set when a change in VBUS is detected indicating a session valid or a session no longer valid

BitField.name: LINE_STATE_CHG
BitField.description: This interrupt is set when the USB line state (CTL[SE0] and CTL[JSTATE] bits) are stable without change for 1 millisecond, and the value of the line state is different from the last time when the line state was stable

BitField.name: ONEMSEC
BitField.description: This bit is set when the 1 millisecond timer expires

BitField.name: IDCHG
BitField.description: This bit is set when a change in the ID Signal from the USB connector is sensed.

Enum.description: Disables the AVBUSCHG interrupt.
Enables the AVBUSCHG interrupt.
Disables the B_SESS_CHG interrupt.
Enables the B_SESS_CHG interrupt.
Disables the SESSVLDCHG interrupt.
Enables the SESSVLDCHG interrupt.
Disables the LINE_STAT_CHG interrupt.
Enables the LINE_STAT_CHG interrupt.
Diables the 1ms timer interrupt.
Enables the 1ms timer interrupt.
The ID interrupt is disabled
The ID interrupt is enabled
The VBUS voltage is below the A VBUS Valid threshold.
The VBUS voltage is above the A VBUS Valid threshold.
The VBUS voltage is above the B session end threshold.
The VBUS voltage is below the B session end threshold.
The VBUS voltage is below the B session valid threshold
The VBUS voltage is above the B session valid threshold.

BitField.name: LINESTATESTABLE
BitField.description: Indicates that the internal signals that control the LINE_STATE_CHG field of OTGISTAT are stable for at least 1 ms

Enum.description: The LINE_STAT_CHG bit is not yet stable.
The LINE_STAT_CHG bit has been debounced and is stable.

BitField.name: ONEMSECEN
BitField.description: This bit is reserved for the 1ms count, but it is not useful to software.

BitField.name: ID
BitField.description: Indicates the current state of the ID pin on the USB connector

Enum.description: Indicates a Type A cable is plugged into the USB connector.
Indicates no cable is attached or a Type B cable is plugged into the USB connector.
If USB_EN is 1 and HOST_MODE is 0 in the Control Register (CTL), then the D+ Data Line pull-up resistors are enabled. If HOST_MODE is 1 the D+ and D- Data Line pull-down resistors are engaged.
The pull-up and pull-down controls in this register are used.

BitField.name: DMLOW
BitField.description: D- Data Line pull-down resistor enable

Enum.description: D- pulldown resistor is not enabled.
D- pulldown resistor is enabled.

BitField.name: DPLOW
BitField.description: D+ Data Line pull-down resistor enable

Enum.description: D+ pulldown resistor is not enabled.
D+ pulldown resistor is enabled.

BitField.name: DPHIGH
BitField.description: D+ Data Line pullup resistor enable

Enum.description: D+ pullup resistor is not enabled
D+ pullup resistor is enabled

BitField.name: USBRST
BitField.description: This bit is set when the USB Module has decoded a valid USB reset

BitField.name: ERROR
BitField.description: This bit is set when any of the error conditions within Error Interrupt Status (ERRSTAT) register occur

BitField.name: SOFTOK
BitField.description: This bit is set when the USB Module receives a Start Of Frame (SOF) token

BitField.name: TOKDNE
BitField.description: This bit is set when the current token being processed has completed

BitField.name: SLEEP
BitField.description: This bit is set when the USB Module detects a constant idle on the USB bus for 3 ms

BitField.name: RESUME
BitField.description: This bit is set when a K-state is observed on the DP/DM signals for 2

Enum.description: No Attach is detected since the last time the ATTACH bit was cleared.
A peripheral is now present and must be configured (a stable non-SE0 state is detected for more than 2.5 us).
Disables the USBRST interrupt.
Enables the USBRST interrupt.
Disables the ERROR interrupt.
Enables the ERROR interrupt.
Disbles the SOFTOK interrupt.
Enables the SOFTOK interrupt.
Disables the TOKDNE interrupt.
Enables the TOKDNE interrupt.
Disables the SLEEP interrupt.
Enables the SLEEP interrupt.
Disables the RESUME interrupt.
Enables the RESUME interrupt.
Disables the ATTACH interrupt.
Enables the ATTACH interrupt.
Diasbles the STALL interrupt.
Enables the STALL interrupt.

BitField.name: PIDERR
BitField.description: This bit is set when the PID check field fails.

BitField.name: CRC5EOF
BitField.description: This error interrupt has two functions

BitField.name: CRC16
BitField.description: This bit is set when a data packet is rejected due to a CRC16 error.

BitField.name: DFN8
BitField.description: This bit is set if the data field received was not 8 bits in length

BitField.name: BTOERR
BitField.description: This bit is set when a bus turnaround timeout error occurs

BitField.name: DMAERR
BitField.description: This bit is set if the USB Module has requested a DMA access to read a new BDT but has not been given the bus before it needs to receive or transmit data

BitField.name: OWNERR
BitField.description: This field is valid when the USB Module is operating in peripheral mode (CTL[HOSTMODEEN]=0)

BitField.name: BTSERR
BitField.description: This bit is set when a bit stuff error is detected

Enum.description: Disables the PIDERR interrupt.
Enters the PIDERR interrupt.
Disables the CRC5/EOF interrupt.
Enables the CRC5/EOF interrupt.
Disables the CRC16 interrupt.
Enables the CRC16 interrupt.
Disables the DFN8 interrupt.
Enables the DFN8 interrupt.
Disables the BTOERR interrupt.
Enables the BTOERR interrupt.
Disables the DMAERR interrupt.
Enables the DMAERR interrupt.
Disables the OWNERR interrupt.
Enables the OWNERR interrupt.
Disables the BTSERR interrupt.
Enables the BTSERR interrupt.

BitField.name: ODD
BitField.description: This bit is set if the last buffer descriptor updated was in the odd bank of the BDT.

Enum.description: The most recent transaction was a receive operation.
The most recent transaction was a transmit operation.

BitField.name: ENDP
BitField.description: This four-bit field encodes the endpoint address that received or transmitted the previous token

Enum.description: Disables the USB Module.
Enables the USB Module.

BitField.name: ODDRST
BitField.description: Setting this bit to 1 resets all the BDT ODD ping/pong fields to 0, which then specifies the EVEN BDT bank

BitField.name: RESUME
BitField.description: When set to 1 this bit enables the USB Module to execute resume signaling

BitField.name: HOSTMODEEN
BitField.description: When set to 1, this bit enables the USB Module to operate in Host mode

BitField.name: RESET
BitField.description: Setting this bit enables the USB Module to generate USB reset signaling

BitField.name: TXSUSPENDTOKENBUSY
BitField.description: In Host mode, TOKEN_BUSY is set when the USB module is busy executing a USB token

BitField.name: SE0
BitField.description: Live USB Single Ended Zero signal

BitField.name: JSTATE
BitField.description: Live USB differential receiver JSTATE signal

BitField.name: BDTBA
BitField.description: Provides address bits 15 through 9 of the BDT base address.

BitField.name: FRM
BitField.description: This 8-bit field and the 3-bit field in the Frame Number Register High are used to compute the address where the current Buffer Descriptor Table (BDT) resides in system memory

BitField.name: FRM
BitField.description: This 3-bit field and the 8-bit field in the Frame Number Register Low are used to compute the address where the current Buffer Descriptor Table (BDT) resides in system memory

BitField.name: TOKENENDPT
BitField.description: Holds the Endpoint address for the token command

BitField.name: TOKENPID
BitField.description: Contains the token type executed by the USB module.

Enum.description: OUT Token. USB Module performs an OUT (TX) transaction.
IN Token. USB Module performs an In (RX) transaction.
SETUP Token. USB Module performs a SETUP (TX) transaction

BitField.name: CNT
BitField.description: Represents the SOF count threshold in byte times when SOFDYNTHLD=0 or 8 byte times when SOFDYNTHLD=1

BitField.name: BDTBA
BitField.description: Provides address bits 23 through 16 of the BDT base address that defines the location of Buffer Descriptor Table resides in system memory

BitField.name: BDTBA
BitField.description: Provides address bits 31 through 24 of the BDT base address that defines the location of Buffer Descriptor Table resides in system memory

BitField.name: EPHSHK
BitField.description: When set this bit enables an endpoint to perform handshaking during a transaction to this endpoint

BitField.name: EPSTALL
BitField.description: When set this bit indicates that the endpoint is called

BitField.name: EPTXEN
BitField.description: This bit, when set, enables the endpoint for TX transfers. See

BitField.name: EPRXEN
BitField.description: This bit, when set, enables the endpoint for RX transfers. See

BitField.name: EPCTLDIS
BitField.description: This bit, when set, disables control (SETUP) transfers

BitField.name: RETRYDIS
BitField.description: This is a Host mode only bit and is present in the control register for endpoint 0 (ENDPT0) only

BitField.name: HOSTWOHUB
BitField.description: Host without a hub This is a Host mode only field and is present in the control register for endpoint 0 (ENDPT0) only

Enum.description: Low-speed device connected to Host through a hub. PRE_PID will be generated as required.
Low-speed device directly connected. No hub, or no low-speed device attached.

BitField.name: UARTSEL
BitField.description: Selects USB signals to be used as UART signals.

Enum.description: USB signals not used as UART signals.
USB signals used as UART signals.
USB DP/DM signals used as UART TX/RX.
USB DP/DM signals used as UART RX/TX.

BitField.name: PDE
BitField.description: Enables the weak pulldowns on the USB transceiver.

Enum.description: Weak pulldowns are disabled on D+ and D-.
Weak pulldowns are enabled on D+ and D-.

BitField.name: SUSP
BitField.description: Places the USB transceiver into the suspend state.

Enum.description: USB transceiver is not in suspend state.
USB transceiver is in suspend state.

BitField.name: DMPD
BitField.description: Provides observability of the D- Pulldown enable at the USB transceiver.

Enum.description: D- pulldown disabled.
D- pulldown enabled.

BitField.name: DPPD
BitField.description: Provides observability of the D+ Pulldown enable at the USB transceiver.

Enum.description: D+ pulldown disabled.
D+ pulldown enabled.

BitField.name: DPPU
BitField.description: Provides observability of the D+ Pullup enable at the USB transceiver.

Enum.description: D+ pullup disabled.
D+ pullup enabled.

BitField.name: DPPULLUPNONOTG
BitField.description: Provides control of the DP Pullup in USBOTG, if USB is configured in non-OTG device mode.

Enum.description: DP Pullup in non-OTG device mode is not enabled.
DP Pullup in non-OTG device mode is enabled.
No interrupt was generated.
Interrupt was generated because of the USB asynchronous interrupt.
Synchronous interrupt has not been detected.
Synchronous interrupt has been detected.

BitField.name: USB_CLK_RECOVERY_INT
BitField.description: Combined USB Clock Recovery interrupt status

Enum.description: VBUS rising edge interrupt has not been detected.
VBUS rising edge interrupt has been detected.
VBUS falling edge interrupt has not been detected.
VBUS falling edge interrupt has been detected.
USB asynchronous wakeup from suspend mode disabled.

USB asynchronous wakeup from suspend mode enabled. The asynchronous resume interrupt differs from the synchronous resume interrupt in that it asynchronously detects K-state using the unfiltered state of the D+ and D- pins. This interrupt should only be enabled when the Transceiver is suspended.
Normal USB module operation.
Returns the USB module to its reset state.
SOF_TOK interrupt is set when byte times SOF threshold is reached.
SOF_TOK interrupt is set when 8 byte times SOF threshold is reached or overstepped.
SOF_TOK interrupt is set according to SOF threshold value.
SOF_TOK interrupt is set when SOF counter reaches 0.

BitField.name: OWNERRISODIS
BitField.description: OWN Error Detect for ISO IN / ISO OUT Disable

Enum.description: OWN error detect for ISO IN / ISO OUT is not disabled.
OWN error detect for ISO IN / ISO OUT is disabled.
VBUS rising edge interrupt disabled.
VBUS rising edge interrupt enabled.
VBUS falling edge interrupt disabled.
VBUS falling edge interrupt enabled.
Trim fine adjustment always works based on the previous updated trim fine value (default)
Trim fine restarts from the IFR trim value whenever bus_reset/bus_resume is detected or module enable is desasserted
Always works in tracking phase after the 1st time rough to track transition (default)
Go back to rough stage whenever bus reset or bus resume occurs
Disable clock recovery block (default)
Enable clock recovery block
IRC48M local regulator is disabled
IRC48M local regulator is enabled (default)
Disable the IRC48M module (default)
Enable the IRC48M module

BitField.name: OVF_ERROR_EN
BitField.description: Determines whether OVF_ERROR condition signal is used in generation of USB_CLK_RECOVERY_INT.

Enum.description: The interrupt will be masked
The interrupt will be enabled (default)

BitField.name: OVF_ERROR
BitField.description: Indicates that the USB clock recovery algorithm has detected that the frequency trim adjustment needed for the IRC48M output clock is outside the available TRIM_FINE adjustment range for the IRC48M module

Enum.description: No interrupt is reported
Unmasked interrupt has been generated

RegisterGroup.name: CMP0
RegisterGroup.description: High-Speed Comparator (CMP), Voltage Reference (VREF) Digital-to-Analog Converter (DAC), and Analog Mux (ANMUX)

Enum.description: Level 0
Level 1
Level 2
Level 3
Filter is disabled. If SE = 1, then COUT is a logic 0. This is not a legal state, and is not recommended. If SE = 0, COUT = COUTA.
One sample must agree. The comparator output is simply sampled.
2 consecutive samples must agree.
3 consecutive samples must agree.
4 consecutive samples must agree.
5 consecutive samples must agree.
6 consecutive samples must agree.
7 consecutive samples must agree.
Analog Comparator is disabled.
Analog Comparator is enabled.
CMPO is not available on the associated CMPO output pin. If the comparator does not own the pin, this field has no effect.

CMPO is available on the associated CMPO output pin. The comparator output (CMPO) is driven out on the associated CMPO output pin if the comparator owns the pin. If the comparator does not own the field, this bit has no effect.
Set the filtered comparator output (CMPO) to equal COUT.
Set the unfiltered comparator output (CMPO) to equal COUTA.
Does not invert the comparator output.
Inverts the comparator output.
Low-Speed (LS) Comparison mode selected. In this mode, CMP has slower output propagation delay and lower current consumption.
High-Speed (HS) Comparison mode selected. In this mode, CMP has faster output propagation delay and higher current consumption.
Trigger mode is disabled.
Trigger mode is enabled.
Windowing mode is not selected.
Windowing mode is selected.
Sampling mode is not selected.
Sampling mode is selected.

Falling-edge on COUT has occurred.
Rising-edge on COUT has not been detected.
Rising-edge on COUT has occurred.
Interrupt is disabled.
Interrupt is enabled.
Interrupt is disabled.
Interrupt is enabled.
DMA is disabled.
DMA is enabled.
Vin1 is selected as resistor ladder network supply reference.
Vin2 is selected as resistor ladder network supply reference.
DAC is disabled.
DAC is enabled.

LPUART receiver idle waiting for a start bit.
LPUART receiver active (LPUART_RX input not idle).
Break character is detected at length 10 bit times (if M = 0, SBNS = 0) or 11 (if M = 1, SBNS = 0 or M = 0, SBNS = 1) or 12 (if M = 1, SBNS = 1 or M10 = 1, SNBS = 0) or 13 (if M10 = 1, SNBS = 1).
Break character is detected at length of 11 bit times (if M = 0, SBNS = 0) or 12 (if M = 1, SBNS = 0 or M = 0, SBNS = 1) or 14 (if M = 1, SBNS = 1 or M10 = 1, SNBS = 0) or 15 (if M10 = 1, SNBS = 1).

Break character is transmitted with length of 10 bit times (if M = 0, SBNS = 0) or 11 (if M = 1, SBNS = 0 or M = 0, SBNS = 1) or 12 (if M = 1, SBNS = 1 or M10 = 1, SNBS = 0) or 13 (if M10 = 1, SNBS = 1).

Break character is transmitted with length of 13 bit times (if M = 0, SBNS = 0) or 14 (if M = 1, SBNS = 0 or M = 0, SBNS = 1) or 15 (if M = 1, SBNS = 1 or M10 = 1, SNBS = 0) or 16 (if M10 = 1, SNBS = 1).
During receive standby state (RWU = 1), the IDLE bit does not get set upon detection of an idle character. During address match wakeup, the IDLE bit does not get set when an address does not match.
During receive standby state (RWU = 1), the IDLE bit gets set upon detection of an idle character. During address match wakeup, the IDLE bit does get set when an address does not match.
Receive data not inverted.
Receive data inverted.
LSB (bit0) is the first bit that is transmitted following the start bit. Further, the first bit received after the start bit is identified as bit0.

MSB (bit9, bit8, bit7 or bit6) is the first bit that is transmitted following the start bit depending on the setting of CTRL[M], CTRL[PE] and BAUD[M10]. Further, the first bit received after the start bit is identified as bit9, bit8, bit7 or bit6 depending on the setting of CTRL[M] and CTRL[PE].

BitField.name: NOISY

Enum.description: The dataword was received without noise.
The data was received with noise.
CTS has no effect on the transmitter.

Enables clear-to-send operation. The transmitter checks the state of CTS each time it is ready to send a character. If CTS is asserted, the character is sent. If CTS is deasserted, the signal TXD remains in the mark state and transmission is delayed until CTS is asserted. Changes in CTS as a character is being sent do not affect its transmission.
The transmitter has no effect on RTS.

When a character is placed into an empty transmitter data buffer , RTS asserts one bit time before the start bit is transmitted. RTS deasserts one bit time after all characters in the transmitter data buffer and shift register are completely sent, including the last stop bit.
Transmitter RTS is active low.
Transmitter RTS is active high.
The receiver has no effect on RTS.

RTS is deasserted if the receiver data register is full or a start bit has been detected that would cause the receiver data register to become full. RTS is asserted if the receiver data register is not full and has not detected a start bit that would cause the receiver data register to become full.
CTS input is sampled at the start of each character.
CTS input is sampled when the transmitter is idle.
CTS input is the LPUART_CTS pin.
CTS input is the inverted Receiver Match result.
RTS asserts when the receiver FIFO is full or receiving a character that causes the FIFO to become full.
RTS asserts when the receive FIFO is less than or equal to the RXWATER configuration and negates when the receive FIFO is greater than the RXWATER configuration.

IR enabled.

BitField.description: Read receive data buffer 0 or write transmit data buffer 0.

BitField.name: R1T1
BitField.description: Read receive data buffer 1 or write transmit data buffer 1.

BitField.name: R2T2
BitField.description: Read receive data buffer 2 or write transmit data buffer 2.

BitField.name: R3T3
BitField.description: Read receive data buffer 3 or write transmit data buffer 3.

BitField.name: R4T4
BitField.description: Read receive data buffer 4 or write transmit data buffer 4.

BitField.name: R5T5
BitField.description: Read receive data buffer 5 or write transmit data buffer 5.

BitField.name: R6T6
BitField.description: Read receive data buffer 6 or write transmit data buffer 6.

BitField.name: R7T7
BitField.description: Read receive data buffer 7 or write transmit data buffer 7.

BitField.name: R8T8
BitField.description: Read receive data buffer 8 or write transmit data buffer 8.

BitField.name: R9T9
BitField.description: Read receive data buffer 9 or write transmit data buffer 9.

Enum.description: Receiver was not idle before receiving this character.
Receiver was idle before receiving this character.
Receive buffer contains valid data.
Receive buffer is empty, data returned on read is not valid.
The dataword was received without a frame error on read, transmit a normal character on write.
The dataword was received with a frame error, transmit an idle or break character on transmit.

BitField.name: PARITYE
BitField.description: The current received dataword contained in DATA[R9:R0] was received with a parity error.

Enum.description: The dataword was received without a parity error.
The dataword was received with a parity error.

BitField.name: NOISY
BitField.description: The current received dataword contained in DATA[R9:R0] was received with noise.

Enum.description: The dataword was received without noise.
The data was received with noise.
CTS has no effect on the transmitter.

Enables clear-to-send operation. The transmitter checks the state of CTS each time it is ready to send a character. If CTS is asserted, the character is sent. If CTS is deasserted, the signal TXD remains in the mark state and transmission is delayed until CTS is asserted. Changes in CTS as a character is being sent do not affect its transmission.
The transmitter has no effect on RTS.

When a character is placed into an empty transmitter data buffer , RTS asserts one bit time before the start bit is transmitted. RTS deasserts one bit time after all characters in the transmitter data buffer and shift register are completely sent, including the last stop bit.
Transmitter RTS is active low.
Transmitter RTS is active high.
The receiver has no effect on RTS.

RTS is deasserted if the receiver data register is full or a start bit has been detected that would cause the receiver data register to become full. RTS is asserted if the receiver data register is not full and has not detected a start bit that would cause the receiver data register to become full.
CTS input is sampled at the start of each character.
CTS input is sampled when the transmitter is idle.
CTS input is the LPUART_CTS pin.
CTS input is the inverted Receiver Match result.
RTS asserts when the receiver FIFO is full or receiving a character that causes the FIFO to become full.
RTS asserts when the receive FIFO is less than or equal to the RXWATER configuration and negates when the receive FIFO is greater than the RXWATER configuration.
IR disabled.
IR enabled.
Receive FIFO/Buffer depth = 1 dataword.
Receive FIFO/Buffer depth = 4 datawords.
Receive FIFO/Buffer depth = 8 datawords.
Receive FIFO/Buffer depth = 16 datawords.
Receive FIFO/Buffer depth = 32 datawords.
Receive FIFO/Buffer depth = 64 datawords.
Receive FIFO/Buffer depth = 128 datawords.
Receive FIFO/Buffer depth = 256 datawords.
Receive FIFO is not enabled. Buffer is depth 1. (Legacy support)
Receive FIFO is enabled. Buffer is depth indicted by RXFIFOSIZE.
Transmit FIFO/Buffer depth = 1 dataword.
Transmit FIFO/Buffer depth = 4 datawords.
Transmit FIFO/Buffer depth = 8 datawords.
Transmit FIFO/Buffer depth = 16 datawords.
Transmit FIFO/Buffer depth = 32 datawords.
Transmit FIFO/Buffer depth = 64 datawords.
Transmit FIFO/Buffer depth = 128 datawords.
Transmit FIFO/Buffer depth = 256 datawords
Transmit FIFO is not enabled. Buffer is depth 1. (Legacy support).
Transmit FIFO is enabled. Buffer is depth indicated by TXFIFOSIZE.
RXUF flag does not generate an interrupt to the host.
RXUF flag generates an interrupt to the host.
TXOF flag does not generate an interrupt to the host.
TXOF flag generates an interrupt to the host.
Disable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle.
Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 1 character.
Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 2 characters.
Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 4 characters.
Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 8 characters.
Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 16 characters.
Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 32 characters.
Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 64 characters.
No flush operation occurs.
All data in the receive FIFO/buffer is cleared out.
No flush operation occurs.
All data in the transmit FIFO/Buffer is cleared out.
No receive buffer underflow has occurred since the last time the flag was cleared.
At least one receive buffer underflow has occurred since the last time the flag was cleared.
No transmit buffer overflow has occurred since the last time the flag was cleared.
At least one transmit buffer overflow has occurred since the last time the flag was cleared.
Receive buffer is not empty.
Receive buffer is empty.
Transmit buffer is not empty.
Transmit buffer is empty.
One stop bit.
Two stop bits.

BitField.name: RXEDGIE
BitField.description: RX Input Active Edge Interrupt Enable

Enum.description: Hardware interrupts from LPUART_STAT[RXEDGIF] disabled (use polling).
Hardware interrupt requested when LPUART_STAT[RXEDGIF] flag is 1.
Hardware interrupts from LPUART_STAT[LBKDIF] disabled (use polling).
Hardware interrupt requested when LPUART_STAT[LBKDIF] flag is 1.
Resynchronization during received data word is supported
Resynchronization during received data word is disabled
Receiver samples input data using the rising edge of the baud rate clock.
Receiver samples input data using the rising and falling edge of the baud rate clock.
Address Match Wakeup
Idle Match Wakeup
Match On and Match Off
Enables RWU on Data Match and Match On/Off for transmitter CTS input
DMA request disabled.
DMA request enabled.
DMA request disabled.
DMA request enabled.
Receiver and transmitter use 8-bit or 9-bit data characters.
Receiver and transmitter use 10-bit data characters.
Normal operation.
Enables automatic address matching or data matching mode for MATCH[MA2].
Normal operation.
Enables automatic address matching or data matching mode for MATCH[MA1].
Received data is not equal to MA2
Received data is equal to MA2
Received data is not equal to MA1
Received data is equal to MA1
No parity error.
Parity error.
No framing error detected. This does not guarantee the framing is correct.
Framing error.
No noise detected.
Noise detected in the received character in LPUART_DATA.
No overrun.
Receive overrun (new LPUART data lost).
No idle line detected.
Idle line was detected.
Receive data buffer empty.
Receive data buffer full.
Transmitter active (sending data, a preamble, or a break).
Transmitter idle (transmission activity complete).
Transmit data buffer full.
Transmit data buffer empty.
LPUART receiver idle waiting for a start bit.
LPUART receiver active (LPUART_RX input not idle).
Break character is detected at length 10 bit times (if M = 0, SBNS = 0) or 11 (if M = 1, SBNS = 0 or M = 0, SBNS = 1) or 12 (if M = 1, SBNS = 1 or M10 = 1, SNBS = 0) or 13 (if M10 = 1, SNBS = 1).
Break character is detected at length of 11 bit times (if M = 0, SBNS = 0) or 12 (if M = 1, SBNS = 0 or M = 0, SBNS = 1) or 14 (if M = 1, SBNS = 1 or M10 = 1, SNBS = 0) or 15 (if M10 = 1, SNBS = 1).

Break character is transmitted with length of 10 bit times (if M = 0, SBNS = 0) or 11 (if M = 1, SBNS = 0 or M = 0, SBNS = 1) or 12 (if M = 1, SBNS = 1 or M10 = 1, SNBS = 0) or 13 (if M10 = 1, SNBS = 1).

Break character is transmitted with length of 13 bit times (if M = 0, SBNS = 0) or 14 (if M = 1, SBNS = 0 or M = 0, SBNS = 1) or 15 (if M = 1, SBNS = 1 or M10 = 1, SNBS = 0) or 16 (if M10 = 1, SNBS = 1).
During receive standby state (RWU = 1), the IDLE bit does not get set upon detection of an idle character. During address match wakeup, the IDLE bit does not get set when an address does not match.
During receive standby state (RWU = 1), the IDLE bit gets set upon detection of an idle character. During address match wakeup, the IDLE bit does get set when an address does not match.
Receive data not inverted.
Receive data inverted.
LSB (bit0) is the first bit that is transmitted following the start bit. Further, the first bit received after the start bit is identified as bit0.

MSB (bit9, bit8, bit7 or bit6) is the first bit that is transmitted following the start bit depending on the setting of CTRL[M], CTRL[PE] and BAUD[M10]. Further, the first bit received after the start bit is identified as bit9, bit8, bit7 or bit6 depending on the setting of CTRL[M] and CTRL[PE].

Break character is detected at length 10 bit times (if M = 0, SBNS = 0) or 11 (if M = 1, SBNS = 0 or M = 0, SBNS = 1) or 12 (if M = 1, SBNS = 1 or M10 = 1, SNBS = 0) or 13 (if M10 = 1, SNBS = 1).
Break character is detected at length of 11 bit times (if M = 0, SBNS = 0) or 12 (if M = 1, SBNS = 0 or M = 0, SBNS = 1) or 14 (if M = 1, SBNS = 1 or M10 = 1, SNBS = 0) or 15 (if M10 = 1, SNBS = 1).

Break character is transmitted with length of 10 bit times (if M = 0, SBNS = 0) or 11 (if M = 1, SBNS = 0 or M = 0, SBNS = 1) or 12 (if M = 1, SBNS = 1 or M10 = 1, SNBS = 0) or 13 (if M10 = 1, SNBS = 1).

Break character is transmitted with length of 13 bit times (if M = 0, SBNS = 0) or 14 (if M = 1, SBNS = 0 or M = 0, SBNS = 1) or 15 (if M = 1, SBNS = 1 or M10 = 1, SNBS = 0) or 16 (if M10 = 1, SNBS = 1).
During receive standby state (RWU = 1), the IDLE bit does not get set upon detection of an idle character. During address match wakeup, the IDLE bit does not get set when an address does not match.
During receive standby state (RWU = 1), the IDLE bit gets set upon detection of an idle character. During address match wakeup, the IDLE bit does get set when an address does not match.
Receive data not inverted.
Receive data inverted.
LSB (bit0) is the first bit that is transmitted following the start bit. Further, the first bit received after the start bit is identified as bit0.

MSB (bit9, bit8, bit7 or bit6) is the first bit that is transmitted following the start bit depending on the setting of CTRL[M], CTRL[PE] and BAUD[M10]. Further, the first bit received after the start bit is identified as bit9, bit8, bit7 or bit6 depending on the setting of CTRL[M] and CTRL[PE].

CTS has no effect on the transmitter.

Enables clear-to-send operation. The transmitter checks the state of CTS each time it is ready to send a character. If CTS is asserted, the character is sent. If CTS is deasserted, the signal TXD remains in the mark state and transmission is delayed until CTS is asserted. Changes in CTS as a character is being sent do not affect its transmission.
The transmitter has no effect on RTS.

When a character is placed into an empty transmitter data buffer , RTS asserts one bit time before the start bit is transmitted. RTS deasserts one bit time after all characters in the transmitter data buffer and shift register are completely sent, including the last stop bit.
Transmitter RTS is active low.
Transmitter RTS is active high.
The receiver has no effect on RTS.

RTS is deasserted if the receiver data register is full or a start bit has been detected that would cause the receiver data register to become full. RTS is asserted if the receiver data register is not full and has not detected a start bit that would cause the receiver data register to become full.

CTS input is sampled when the transmitter is idle.
CTS input is the LPUART_CTS pin.

Register.name: EMVSIM1_GPCNT0_VAL
Register.description: General Purpose Counter 0 Timeout Value Register

BitField.name: SWRSTSD
BitField.description: Software reset for Serial Flash domain

Enum.description: No action

Serial Flash domain flops are reset. Does not reset configuration registers. It is advisable to reset both the serial flash domain and AHB domain at the same time. Resetting only one domain might lead to side effects. The software resets need the clock to be running to propagate to the design. The MCR[MDIS] should therefore be set to 0 when the software reset bits are asserted. Also, before they can be deasserted again (by setting MCR[SWRSTSD] to 0), it is recommended to set the MCR[MDIS] bit to 1. Once the software resets have been deasserted, the normal operation can be started by setting the MCR[MDIS] bit to 0.
No action

AHB domain flops are reset. Does not reset configuration registers. It is advisable to reset both the serial flash domain and AHB domain at the same time. Resetting only one domain might lead to side effects. The software resets need the clock to be running to propagate to the design. The MCR[MDIS] should therefore be set to 0 when the software reset bits are asserted. Also, before they can be deasserted again (by setting MCR[SWRSTHD] to 0), it is recommended to set the MCR[MDIS] bit to 1. Once the software resets have been deasserted, the normal operation can be started by setting the MCR[MDIS] bit to 0.

BitField.name: END_CFG
BitField.description: Defines the endianness of the QSPI module.For more details refer to Byte Ordering Endianess

BitField.name: DQS_LAT_EN
BitField.description: DQS Latency Enable: This field is valid when latency is included in between read access from FLash in case when QSPI_MCR[DQS_EN] is 1

Enum.description: DQS Latency disabled
DQS feature with latency included enabled

BitField.name: DQS_EN
BitField.description: DQS enable: This field is valid for both SDR and DDR mode

Enum.description: DQS disabled.

DQS enabled- When enabled, the incoming data is sampled on both the edges of DQS input when QSPI_MCR[DDR_EN] is set, else, on only one edge when QSPI_MCR[DDR_EN] is 0. The QSPI_SMPR[DDR_SMP] values are ignored.
2x and 4x clocks are disabled for SDR instructions only
2x and 4x clocks are enabled supports both SDR and DDR instruction.

BitField.name: CLR_RXF
BitField.description: Clear RX FIFO. Invalidate the RX Buffer. This is a self-clearing field.

Enum.description: No action.
Read and write pointers of the RX Buffer are reset to 0. QSPI_RBSR[RDBFL] is reset to 0.

BitField.name: CLR_TXF
BitField.description: Clear TX FIFO/Buffer. Invalidate the TX Buffer content. This is a self-clearing field.

Enum.description: No action.
Read and write pointers of the TX Buffer are reset to 0. QSPI_TBSR[TRCTR] is reset to 0.
Enable QuadSPI clocks.
Allow external logic to disable QuadSPI clocks.

BitField.name: IDATSZ
BitField.description: IP data transfer size: Defines the data transfer size in bytes of the IP command.

BitField.name: PAR_EN
BitField.description: When set, a transaction to two serial flash devices is triggered in parallel mode

BitField.name: SEQID
BitField.description: Points to a sequence in the Look-up-table

BitField.name: TCSS
BitField.description: Serial flash CS setup time in terms of serial flash clock cycles

BitField.name: TCSH
BitField.description: Serial flash CS hold time in terms of serial flash clock cycles

BitField.name: TDH
BitField.description: Serial flash Data In hold time: This helps in meeting the Data In Hold time requirement of a Flash

Enum.description: Data aligned with the posedge of Internal reference clock of QuadSPI
Data aligned with 2x serial flash half clock
Data aligned with 4x serial flash half clock

BitField.description: When this bit is set the internal generated DQS is selected and looped back to QuadSPI, without going to DQS pad. DQSPADLPEN should be cleared when this bit is set.

BitField.name: DQSPADLPEN
BitField.description: When this bit is set the internal generated DQS will be sent to the DQS pad first and then looped back to QuadSPI. DQSLPEN should be cleared when this bit is set.

DQS loop back from DQS pad is enabled

BitField.description: Half Speed Delay selection for SDR instructions.

BitField.description: Full Speed Phase selection for SDR instructions.

Enum.description: Select sampling at non-inverted clock
Select sampling at inverted clock. This bit is also used in DQS mode and ignored when using non-DQS DDR instructions.

BitField.name: FSDLY
BitField.description: Full Speed Delay selection for SDR instructions. Select the delay with respect to the reference edge for the sample point valid for full speed commands:

Enum.description: One clock cycle delay
Two clock cycles delay. This bit is also used in DQS mode and ignored when using non-DQS DDR instructions.

BitField.name: RDBFL
BitField.description: RX Buffer Fill Level, indicates how many entries of 4 bytes are still available in the RX Buffer

BitField.name: RDCTR
BitField.description: Read Counter, indicates how many entries of 4 bytes have been removed from the RX Buffer

BitField.name: WMRK
BitField.description: RX Buffer Watermark: This field determines when the readout action of the RX Buffer is triggered

BitField.name: RXBRD
BitField.description: RX Buffer Readout: This bit specifies the access scheme for the RX Buffer readout.

Enum.description: RX Buffer content is read using the AHB Bus registers QSPI_ARDB0 to QSPI_ARDB15. For details, refer to Exclusive Access to Serial Flash for AHB Commands.
RX Buffer content is read using the IP Bus registers QSPI_RBDR0 to QSPI_RBDR15.

BitField.name: TXDATA
BitField.description: TX Data On write access the data is written into the next available entry of the TX Buffer and the QPSI_TBSR[TRBFL] field is updated accordingly

BitField.name: WMRK
BitField.description: Determines the watermark for the TX Buffer

BitField.name: BUSY
BitField.description: Module Busy: Asserted when module is currently busy handling a transaction to an external flash device

BitField.name: IP_ACC
BitField.description: IP Access: Asserted when transaction currently executed was initiated by IP bus.

BitField.name: AHB_ACC
BitField.description: AHB Access: Asserted when the transaction currently executed was initiated by AHB bus.

BitField.name: AHBGNT
BitField.description: AHB Command priority Granted: Asserted when another module has been granted priority of AHB Commands against IP Commands

BitField.name: AHBTRN
BitField.description: AHB Access Transaction pending: Asserted when there is a pending request on the AHB interface

BitField.name: AHB0NE
BitField.description: AHB 0 Buffer Not Empty: Asserted when AHB 0 buffer contains data.

BitField.name: AHB1NE
BitField.description: AHB 1 Buffer Not Empty: Asserted when AHB 1 buffer contains data.

BitField.name: AHB2NE
BitField.description: AHB 2 Buffer Not Empty: Asserted when AHB 2 buffer contains data.

BitField.name: AHB3NE
BitField.description: AHB 3 Buffer Not Empty: Asserted when AHB 3 buffer contains data.

BitField.name: AHB0FUL
BitField.description: AHB 0 Buffer Full: Asserted when AHB 0 buffer is full.

BitField.name: AHB1FUL
BitField.description: AHB 1 Buffer Full: Asserted when AHB 1 buffer is full.

BitField.name: AHB2FUL
BitField.description: AHB 2 Buffer Full: Asserted when AHB 2 buffer is full.

BitField.name: AHB3FUL
BitField.description: AHB 3 Buffer Full: Asserted when AHB 3 buffer is full.

BitField.name: RXWE
BitField.description: RX Buffer Watermark Exceeded: Asserted when the number of valid entries in the RX Buffer exceeds the number given in the QSPI_RBCT[WMRK] field

BitField.name: RXFULL
BitField.description: RX Buffer Full: Asserted when the RX Buffer is full, i

BitField.name: RXDMA
BitField.description: RX Buffer DMA: Asserted when RX Buffer read out via DMA is active i.e DMA is requested or running.

BitField.name: TXFULL
BitField.description: TX Buffer Full: Asserted when no more data can be stored.

BitField.name: DLPSMP
BitField.description: Data learning pattern sampling point: The sampling point found by the controller with the data learning pattern

BitField.name: TFF
BitField.description: IP Command Transaction Finished Flag: Set when the QuadSPI module has finished a running IP Command

BitField.name: IPGEF
BitField.description: IP Command Trigger during AHB Grant Error Flag: Set when the following condition occurs: A write access occurs to the QSPI_IPCR[SEQID] field and the QSPI_SR[AHBGNT] bit is set

BitField.name: IPIEF
BitField.description: IP Command Trigger could not be executed Error Flag

BitField.name: IPAEF
BitField.description: IP Command Trigger during AHB Access Error Flag

BitField.name: IUEF
BitField.description: IP Command Usage Error Flag: Set when in parallel flash mode the execution of an IP Command is started with more than one pad enabled and the sequence pointed to by the sequence ID contains a WRITE or a WRITE_DDR command

BitField.name: ABOF
BitField.description: AHB Buffer Overflow Flag: Set when the size of the AHB access exceeds the size of the AHB buffer

BitField.name: AIBSEF
BitField.description: AHB Illegal Burst Size Error Flag: Set whenever the total burst size(size x beat) of an AHB transaction is greater than the prefetch data size

BitField.name: ABSEF
BitField.description: AHB Sequence Error Flag: Set when the execution of an AHB Command is started with a WRITE or WRITE_DDR Command in the sequence pointed to by the QSPI_BUFxCR register

BitField.name: RBDF
BitField.description: RX Buffer Drain Flag: Will be set if the QuadSPI_SR[RXWE] status bit is asserted

BitField.name: RBOF
BitField.description: RX Buffer Overflow Flag: Set when not all the data read from the serial flash device could be pushed into the RX Buffer

BitField.name: ILLINE
BitField.description: Illegal Instruction Error Flag: Set when an illegal instruction is encountered by the controller in any of the sequences

BitField.name: TBUF
BitField.description: TX Buffer Underrun Flag: Set when the module tried to pull data although TX Buffer was emptyor the buffer contains less than 128bits of data

BitField.name: TBFF
BitField.description: TX Buffer Fill Flag: Before writing to the TX buffer, this bit should be cleared

BitField.name: DLPFF
BitField.description: Data Learning Pattern Failure Flag: Set when DATA_LEARN instruction was encountered in a sequence but no sampling point was found for the data learning patternin case only 8 bit data learning is requested for non DQS mode

BitField.name: SUSPND
BitField.description: When set, it signifies that a sequence is in suspended state

BitField.name: SPDBUF
BitField.description: Suspended Buffer: Provides the suspended buffer number. Valid only when SUSPND is set to 1'b1

BitField.name: DATLFT
BitField.description: Data left: Provides information about the amount of data left to be read in the suspended sequence

BitField.name: BFPTRC
BitField.description: Buffer Pointer Clear: 1: Clears the sequence pointer for AHB accesses as defined in QuadSPI_BFGENCR

BitField.name: IPPTRC
BitField.description: IP Pointer Clear: 1: Clears the sequence pointer for IP accesses as defined in QuadSPI_IPCR This is a self-clearing field

BitField.name: TPADA1
BitField.description: Top address for Serial Flash A1. In effect, TPADxx is the first location of the next memory.

BitField.name: TPADA2
BitField.description: Top address for Serial Flash A2. In effect, TPxxAD is the first location of the next memory.

BitField.name: TPADB1
BitField.description: Top address for Serial Flash B1.In effect, TPxxAD is the first location of the next memory.

BitField.name: TPADB2
BitField.description: Top address for Serial Flash B2. In effect, TPxxAD is the first location of the next memory.

BitField.name: DLPV
BitField.description: Data Learning Pattern Value: This value is used for data learning in DDR and DQS mode

BitField.name: KEY
BitField.description: The key to lock or unlock the LUT. The KEY is 0x5AF05AF0. The read value is always 0x5AF05AF0

BitField.name: LOCK
BitField.description: Locks the LUT when the following condition is met: This register is written just after the LUTKEYLUT Key Register The LUT key register was written with 0x5AF05AF0 key

BitField.name: UNLOCK
BitField.description: Unlocks the LUT when the following two conditions are met: 1

RegisterGroup.name: FLEXIO0
RegisterGroup.description: The FLEXIO Memory Map/Register Definition can be found here.

Enum.description: Standard features implemented.
Supports state, logic and parallel modes.
FlexIO module is disabled.
FlexIO module is enabled.
Software reset is disabled
Software reset is enabled, all FlexIO registers except the Control Register are reset.
Configures for normal register accesses to FlexIO
Configures for fast register accesses to FlexIO
FlexIO is disabled in debug modes.
FlexIO is enabled in debug modes
FlexIO enabled in Doze modes.
FlexIO disabled in Doze modes.
Status flag is clear
Status flag is set
Shifter Error Flag is clear
Shifter Error Flag is set
Timer Status Flag is clear
Timer Status Flag is set
Shifter Status Flag interrupt disabled
Shifter Status Flag interrupt enabled
Shifter Error Flag interrupt disabled
Shifter Error Flag interrupt enabled
Timer Status Flag interrupt is disabled
Timer Status Flag interrupt is enabled
Shifter Status Flag DMA request is disabled
Shifter Status Flag DMA request is enabled
Receive mode. Captures the current Shifter content into the SHIFTBUF on expiration of the Timer.
Transmit mode. Load SHIFTBUF contents into the Shifter on expiration of the Timer.
Match Store mode. Shifter data is compared to SHIFTBUF content on expiration of the Timer.
Match Continuous mode. Shifter data is continuously compared to SHIFTBUF contents.
State mode. SHIFTBUF contents are used for storing programmable state attributes.
Logic mode. SHIFTBUF contents are used for implementing programmable logic look up table.
Pin is active high
Pin is active low
Shifter pin output disabled
Shifter pin open drain or bidirectional output enable
Shifter pin bidirectional output data
Shifter pin output
Shift on posedge of Shift clock
Shift on negedge of Shift clock

BitField.name: DISDEFWBUF
BitField.description: Disables write buffer use during default memory map accesses.

Enum.description: there are preempted active exceptions to execute
there are no active exceptions, or the currently-executing exception is the only active exception

BitField.name: VECTPENDING
BitField.description: Exception number of the highest priority pending enabled exception

Enum.description: Will not service
Will service a pending exception
no effect
removes the pending state from the SysTick exception
write: no effect; read: SysTick exception is not pending
write: changes SysTick exception state to pending; read: SysTick exception is pending
no effect
removes the pending state from the PendSV exception
write: no effect; read: PendSV exception is not pending
write: changes PendSV exception state to pending; read: PendSV exception is pending
write: no effect; read: NMI exception is not pending
write: changes NMI exception state to pending; read: NMI exception is pending

Register.name: SCB_AIRCR
Register.description: Application Interrupt and Reset Control Register

Enum.description: no system reset request
asserts a signal to the outer system that requests a reset

BitField.name: PRIGROUP
BitField.description: Interrupt priority grouping field. This field determines the split of group priority from subpriority.

Enum.description: o not sleep when returning to Thread mode
enter sleep, or deep sleep, on return from an ISR
deep sleep
only enabled interrupts or events can wakeup the processor, disabled interrupts are excluded
enabled events and all interrupts, including disabled interrupts, can wakeup the processor
processor can enter Thread mode only when no exception is active
processor can enter Thread mode from any level under the control of an EXC_RETURN value

BitField.name: USERSETMPEND
BitField.description: Enables unprivileged software access to the STIR

Enum.description: do not trap unaligned halfword and word accesses
trap unaligned halfword and word accesses

BitField.name: DIV_0_TRP
BitField.description: Enables faulting or halting when the processor executes an SDIV or UDIV instruction with a divisor of 0

Enum.description: do not trap divide by 0
trap divide by 0

BitField.name: BFHFNMIGN
BitField.description: Enables handlers with priority -1 or -2 to ignore data BusFaults caused by load and store instructions.

Enum.description: data bus faults caused by load and store instructions cause a lock-up
handlers running at priority -1 and -2 ignore data bus faults caused by load and store instructions

BitField.name: STKALIGN
BitField.description: Indicates stack alignment on exception entry

Enum.description: 4-byte aligned
8-byte aligned

BitField.name: PRI_15
BitField.description: Priority of system handler 15, SysTick exception

Register.description: System Handler Control and State Register
